dcterms:creator: Ramon van Handel
dcterms:description: The Dirichlet distribution is used as a prior in Bayesian adaptive data analysis, demonstrating that the posterior mean algorithm achieves the same level of accuracy against adaptive queries as static queries.
dcterms:title: Dirichlet distribution

dcterms:creator: Arjun K Gupta
Saralees Nadarajah
dcterms:description: The Beta distribution is utilized in the context of Bayesian adaptive data analysis, where it serves as a conjugate prior for Bernoulli trials, allowing the posterior to also be a Beta distribution.
dcterms:title: Beta distribution

dcterms:creator: Eric W Weisstein
dcterms:description: The Chi distribution is mentioned in the context of its moments and properties, particularly in relation to subgaussianity and its implications for Bayesian adaptive data analysis.
dcterms:title: Chi distribution
